last_post.content: A recent Firefox update broke USB yubikey/U2F support on several platforms. This toot is a massive thank you to the hundreds of Firefox & rust devs who fixed this )and many other issues in a week), & do some at a layer of the stack I find quite incomprehensible. Y’all rock, from Robert Nagy who is a key maintainer of Firefox both on Open& FreeBSD, to John Schank at Mozilla & countless others. I rely on your work every day and I’m eternally grateful. https://github.com/mozilla/authenticator-rs/issues/ for the complexity.
Turbo-charged variations? https://github.com/Stability-AI/stablediffusion/blob/main/doc/UNCLIP.MD

title: Five things I wish academia understood about my social anxiety

last_post.content:
Five things I wish academia understood about my social anxiety https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-00830-7

"experiences of people struggling with social anxiety in academia vary widely ... my personal wish ... is for greater understanding and acceptance in academic community. Those of us who falter in conversation, avoid social events and look at ceiling when we speak tend not to give good first impressions. We might seem unfriendly and disengaged ... I sincerely hope that what I’ve shared testifies otherwise."

title: The script I use to set up a new mac just the way I like it

last_post.content:
Every time I set up a new mac, I update my install script that gets things most of the way installed for me.

Here's the newest version, in case it's helpful to anybody: https://gist.github.com/llimllib/c4dd0a98a426022b0365d4c0a9090460

- ask you for your new computer's name and set it
- set a bunch of preferences
- install homebrew and a base set of packages, both CLI and apps
- install programming language environments with `asdf`

The script's been in (very intermittent) development for 7 years now!

title: In Japan, cherry blossom forecasting is a big deal. Warming is making it harder.

last_post.content:
🌸Did you know:

Japan has had a long-standing fixation with sakura (cherry blossoms) — in fact cherry blossom records date back to 812! This gives us a data set spanning 1211 years.

This has proven to be a treasure trove for scientists because they have been able to use this data to track a heating planet. (Pictured)

As a result cherry tree blossoms in Japan have been included in the “instrument dashboard” tracking our heating world.

(Graph source: https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2023/03/23/national/cherry-blossom-forecasting/)

#ClimateLiteracy

title: Copyright and Artificial Intelligence | U.S. Copyright Office

last_post.content: The Copyright Office has launched an initiative to examine the copyright law and policy issues raised by artificial intelligence (AI) technology, including the scope of copyright in works generated using AI tools and the use of copyrighted materials in AI training. After convening public listening sessions in the first half of 2023 to gather information about current technologies and their impact, the Office will publish a notice of inquiry in the Federal Register. https://copyright.gov/ai/?loclr=eanco

CVE-2023-21036 / acropalypse is absolutely bonkers.

Apparently for 5+ years the cropping / editing tools for screenshots on Google Pixel phones was only overwriting the start of the screenshot PNG file, but not truncating.

All screenshots shared for the past 5+ years might have data recoverable from them. Demo available at https://acropalypse.app/

Google still hasn't communicated anything on this.

(h/t ItsSimonTime on Musk's site)

Mars Rover's Mastcam View of Possible Mud Cracks

Credits: NASA/JPL-Caltech/MSSS

Instrument: Mastcam
Mission: Mars Science Laboratory (MSL)

title: Neil Young States ‘Concert Touring Is Broken’

last_post.content:
Neil Young States ‘Concert Touring Is Broken’
“I get letters blaming me for $3,000 tickets for a benefit I'm doing” “That money does not go to me or the benefit. Artists have to worry about ripped off fans blaming them for Ticketmaster add-ons & scalpers”

https://www.jambase.com/article/neil-young-touring-is-broken-ticketmaster

Started watching “Vendhu Thanindhathu Kaadu: Part 1 - The Kindling” (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt14182646) today and what a difference from “Pathaan” from yesterday …

It took us quite a few breaks to finish “Pathaan” because it was all style and no real substance. We didn’t care for the main character and almost every situation was predictable. About the only thing that I liked was the bits of humour here and there …

This movie on the other hand is raw … I’ve been in the kind of situations that the movie portrays — well, maybe not 36 people sleeping in a single room and being part of a gang, but I have had to live in strange cities/countries where 4 - 5 of us shared an apartment. I can feel for what is going on in the movie.

And above all, I actually care about the protagonist and want to see what happens to him. This shows life in Mumbai from the not so glamorous side and I want to know more …

#Movies #MiniReview #Tamil #India

#TodayILearned about the Hippocratic License 3.0 (HL3): An Ethical License for Open Source Communities, which "aims to confront the potential harms and abuses technology can have on fundamental human rights. It empowers open source communities to establish a clear set of ethical standards that licensees must abide by in order to adopt their code."¹ There's a builder tool² that allows you to customize the license with specific areas of concern.

¹ https://firstdonoharm.dev
² https://firstdonoharm.dev/build/

title: Ask HN: How are you using GPT to be productive? | Hacker News

last_post.content: Ask HN: How are you using GPT to be productive? - https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=35299071

So for the past couple of weeks, I've been playing with using GPT to transform HTML to JSON, basically enabling one-shot web scrapers.

Like a lot of things with these models, it went from "oh that's interesting" to "wait, it can do that?" really quickly.

I've now turned my experiments into a full-fledged library: https://jamesturk.github.io/scrapeghost/

If you're interested, definitely read through the tutorial, I tried to recapture some of the "wow" discoveries: https://jamesturk.github.io/scrapeghost/tutorial/

Talking About Large Language Models https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.03551v5 #AI #LLM #ChatGPT

Some may not realize, or may not remember, the scale of this gesture.

From an NPR story (https://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2018/10/16/657548752/those-raised-fists-still-resonate-50-years-later) about the protest:

LLMs are going to delay climate progress significantly.

Not only because of their enormous appetite for energy-intensive infrastructure.

But because it will normalize narratives about unpredictable, out-of-control, dangerous computer models.

HadCM3 is going to become interchangeable with ChatGPT. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HadCM3

title: Improv pioneer, creator of Theatresports, mourned by colleagues | CBC News

last_post.content:
I hadn't heard, but Keith Johnstone, father of modern Western #improv, passed away a couple of weeks ago:

https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/improv-pioneer-theatresports-keith-johnstone-mourned-1.6779035

I seriously recommend to everyone to read his book "Impro" - even if you're not into improv. Some amazing lessons on education, drama, and flow states. I seriously find new stuff in it every time I read it!

#theatre #yyc #calgary #theatresports

title: Snowpack in Southern Sierra at all-time record

last_post.content:
“After years of extreme drought and dismal snowpack, #California has had a remarkably wet winter and is now veering into record-setting territory for snowfall.

As of Friday, the snowpack in the southern Sierra was at 286% of normal — the highest figure ever, easily eclipsing the region’s benchmark of 263% set in 1969.” #water

https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2023-03-24/snowpack-in-southern-sierra-at-all-time-record

title: Blog | Quantity is for Production, Quality is for Performance

last_post.content:
Hey! Check out this piece I wrote with @grimalkina! We did a deep lit review across the management and social sciences to talk about wtf #productivity ACTUALLY means, how it’s conflated with things like #production and #performance and how we need to move past looking for a single metric and instead think about #developers holistically and in the context of systems. #softwareengineering

From: @feditips
https://mstdn.social/@feditips@mstdn.social/110068056111910950

My colleague @schopie1 and I have been talking for some time about what might be possible if academic annual review processes were seen as formative (what will make it possible for you do great work in the years ahead) rather than summative (did you do enough this year). He's actively working on a framework for Formative Annual Review (FAR), and I am super excited about where it might lead us.

Edited to add the link I forgot to include: https://hcommons.social/@schopie1/110080183575265341
